title: newAdministrative Assistant - Patient Services
description:
About Oxford Wellness clinic

Oxford Wellness Clinic has been providing quality Chiropractic Care since 2015. We strive to provide the highest quality of evidence-driven holistic care individualized to each patients needs. Our comforting and casual environment is welcoming and will make you feel relaxed each time you visit.

When it comes to patient care, Dr. Sidhu uses a combination of techniques and focuses on treating the root cause of the problem as well as its symptoms. Dr. Sidhu enjoys working with a diverse group of patient demographics and values building long-term relationships of wellness with them.

About YOU

You will be the first point of contact with our patients so to be the right fit for our team, you are friendly, energetic, positive, kind, compassionate and you bring an enthusiastic approach to your everyday. You must feel passionate about wellness and bring that passion to work. You are reliable and on time. If you do not have Clinic experience, do not worry... we have a comprehensive training and onboarding plan.

What is in it for you?

Job Satisfaction: You will be the first point of contact for all our patients, and you will get to work directly with all members of our team and be included in a healthy work environment driven of optimal wellness.

Job Variation: You will never get bored in this fast-paced environment. Each patient is important to us, and you get to be part of their journey to ongoing wellness.

Job Opportunity: You will be exposed to opportunities to grow and develop within our clinic as we continue to expand into other areas of wellness.

Culture: You will get to work with fun, dynamic and highly skilled people that are driven to succeed. Not to mention, everyone here strongly believes in optimal health & wellness for both mind and body.

Qualifications/Required Knowledge & Skills

  • Front desk (First Impressions) administration and patient services experience a MUST.
  • Professional in person and phone etiquette a MUST.
  • Experienced with Chirosuite or other patient booking systems an asset.
  • Experienced with insurance billing an asset.
  • Experienced with MVA billing an asset.
  • Effective and efficient communication skills required.
  • Able to work in fast paced multi-practitioner clinic with a strong sense of priority.
  • Must be able to work any of the clinic hours.
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft office applications, outlook and teams.
  • Must be able to adapt to changes and shifting priorities.

Responsibilities

  • Works to achieve standards of excellence and demonstrates flexible and efficient time management, with a strong ability to prioritize workload and presents positive solutions.
  • Works closely with other administrative assistants, office management, Dr.’s and practitioners’ team to ensure a positive patient experience for all our patients.
  • Providing administrative support with creating documents, spreadsheets and presentations.
  • Responsible for start of day and end of day SOP’s (Standard operating practices) including balancing of Poynt system.
  • Proficient with patient file management including but not limited to:
  • Uploading documents to patients’ files and maintaining files within the existing SOP of the clinic.
  • Strict adherence to patient confidentiality
  • Assisting patients with understanding the MVA protocol.
  • Accurate maintenance of MVA files including documentation, checking end dates, sending reports to adjustors and working with Office Manager and Dr.’s to ensure reporting are completed on time.
  • Accurate collection and recording of patient and clinic information which includes exceptional active listening skills with all team members and patients to ensure treatment plans are understood to assist with optimal wellness in our patients.
  • Responsible for patient follow-up including maintaining call list, following up with patient care to ensure they are scheduled and/or rescheduled as needed.
  • Responsible to adhere to clinic protocol in relation to the internal orthotics program.
  • Adhere to all internal clinic procedures, processes, guidelines & policies.
  • Light cleaning duties daily.
  • Additional job responsibilities as required and assigned by Office Manager.

If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, please contact us with your resume! Stay Healthy & Happy

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $17.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • Front desk: 1 year (required)
  • Administrative experience: 1 year (required)

Language:

  • English (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-13
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: Claims Adjustor II
description:
Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.
Do you have a genuine passion for looking after customers? Are you an experienced casualty claims advisor who wants to be a part of an industry leading, dynamic team? We are recruiting for an Intermediate Claims Professional to join our Atlantic Protect team to handle Casualty claims.
The Claims Adjuster role is to investigate, evaluate, negotiate, and settle Casualty claims in accordance with Aviva's procedures and philosophy. We have a strong focus on strategic indemnity and expense management, in addition to excellent customer service.
The successful candidate will thrive within a high-performance culture, readily accept new challenges, and continually improve their knowledge and skills. The successful candidate will also serve as a mentor to their colleagues while displaying a strong technical ability.
What you’ll do:
  • Interpret and confirm insurance coverage
  • Investigate, evaluate, and settle Casualty claims with claimants or their representatives
  • Direct and manage file investigations and if required instruct IAs as needed
  • Ensure file reserves are timely and accurate
  • Proactively manage communication with our customers and stakeholders
  • Clearly document and summarize file activity
  • Understand and support Aviva’s claim procedures and guidelines
  • Regular and proactive reviews files strategy plans
What you'll bring:
  • University degree or equivalent
  • CIP or working towards CIP.
  • Currently licensed or qualifies to be licensed to handle Casualty Claims in all Atlantic Provinces
  • Experience with Property Damage Liability claims
  • Strong working knowledge of litigation environment (Litigation Assistant, Para-legal)
  • Bilingual French and English is a strong asset
  • Ability to work independently and effectively in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong working knowledge of Personal and Commercial liability claims
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills
  • Well-developed organizational skills
  • Adaptability, flexibility and integrity
  • Committed team player with a positive outlook and sense of humor
What you’ll get
  • Compelling rewards package including base compensation, eligibility for annual bonus, retirement savings, share plan, health benefits, personal wellness, and volunteer opportunities.
  • Outstanding Career Development opportunities.
  • We’ll support your professional development education.
Aviva Canada has an accommodation process in place to provide accommodations for employees with disabilities. If upon commencement of employment you require a specific accommodation because of a disability, please contact your Talent Acquisition Partner so that an appropriate accommodation can be arranged. This process applies throughout your career with Aviva Canada.

title: Front Office Administrator
description:
Established in 2009, reactive health is a busy, growing, multi-disciplinary clinic with six locations spanning across Prince Edward Island servicing all major communities. We are looking for a skilled, passionate, energetic administrative leader to join our team.

The successful candidate will:

· Display strong attention to detail

· Embody a strong and dedicated work ethic

· Show excellent organization, time management and decision making skills

· Display an ability to think and make decisions independently and work effectively as a team

· Exceptional written skills

· Excellent verbal communication skills to provide a high quality patient experience

· Experience in multitasking, efficiently prioritizing demands to excel in a high-paced environment

· Positive attitude with leadership skills to improve team productivity

· Be proficient with computers and experience with appointment scheduling software

. General knowledge of Human Anatomy is considered an assest

Minimum Qualifications:

· Completion of Administrative Assistant/Medical office course

· 1-2+ years experience working in an office setting required.

· Knowledge and understanding of various computer programs, insurance portals and software systems

· Experience working in a multi-disciplinary healthcare setting a strong asset.

· Previous experience in a management/administrative role an asset

Responsibilities:

· Work directly with Clinical Director and multi disciplinary team

· Managing the day-to-day activities of the clinic by providing administrative duties such as: scheduling appointments, answering telephones, scanning, faxing, mailing, etc.

· Greeting patients in a clean, friendly environment and providing information on services offered

· Ensuring confidentiality of patient records and medical information

· Communicate with insurance companies adjustors and case managers

· Maintaining accurate files & patient records, consent forms

· Processing payments, balance end of day transaction reports and collection of all outstanding accounts

· Implement protocols and procedures to improve staff productivity

· Be responsible for managing inventory reports and ordering products

· Follow all reporting requirements for third party vendors – WCB, MVA, LTD claims.

· Laundry and cleaning duties

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • DCS / DEC (preferred)

Experience:

  • Administrative: 2 years (preferred)
  • receptionist: 2 years (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-04-14

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Peak RSG Services is an independent restoration company that operates in major markets across Canada. We provide unsurpassed emergency response, restoration and reconstruction services to the insurance industry supported by an industry leading claims management system and a team of dedicated project co-ordinators and technical experts.

Peak RSG Services is part of The Peak Group of Companies – a leader in the home improvement industry and supplier of innovative building products throughout Canada and the United States. Our greatest strength is our people, a team of remarkably talented and passionate people. We are a place where innovation is encouraged, talent and teamwork are celebrated and results and success are rewarded.

We are experiencing continuous growth and have two immediate openings for the Project Coordinator position. Key Responsibilities and Qualifications include, but are not limited, to the following:

Key Responsibilities

  • Act as the key contact, facilitator and trouble-shooter for the policy holder, and the adjustor, from the initial call to final job completion. Provide helpful, articulate and timely service and updates, both by phone and through Xactware (the industry standard software platform) to the policy holder and adjuster throughout the entire process that delights them.
  • Promptly and professionally responding to all customer and adjuster inquiries, coordinating loss site visits, emergency and restoration work, scheduling arrival of materials, work crews and production schedules.
  • Effectively dispatching work orders to crews, processing deductibles and invoice payments, calculating revenue and expenses of the insurance claims for multiple projects simultaneously timely and accurately.
  • Perform any other duties as assigned by the supervisors.

Experience, Traits and Qualifications

  • Extraordinary organization and multitasking skills, able to administer hundreds of insurance exterior restorations simultaneously and accurately
  • A naturally customer-centric and sales-driven team player who is extremely helpful and always demonstrates a “yes, can do” attitude
  • Excellent communication skills in English (both verbal and written), able to communicate in an engaging, passionate and empathetic manner
  • Demonstrate promptness, professionalism and courtesy at all times by keeping promises and taking good care of our customers
  • Computer proficiency, comfortable using different systems and applications
  • Previous experience navigating XactAnalysis and a Customer Relationship Management system is preferred

The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Bilingual Representative, Insurance
description:
Working together to be our best!

First National is Canada’s largest non-bank lender, originating and servicing both commercial and residential mortgages since 1988. Over the past 30 years, we have been committed to hiring the best and brightest with over 1,000 proud team members. Through cooperation, ongoing coaching, development opportunities and a culture that celebrates both hard work and teamwork, First National team members are supported to lead, learn and grow.
If you are ready to join First National’s dynamic team, while working hard and having fun doing it, we invite you to apply online and let us know how you can be part of our success story.

We are hiring a Bilingual Insurance Representative to join our team!

Reporting To: Manager, Residential Insurance
Full-Time/Part- Time: Full-time
Posting Date: April 22, 2022
Closing Date: April 29, 2022
Hours of Work: 8:30 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.
Grade: 4
Office Location: Fully Remote

What we offer:
Highly competitive compensation package which includes, base salary, bonus, benefits, and career advancement opportunities!
  • Eligibility for benefits is dependent on the terms of employment
The Opportunity:
The Bilingual Property Insurance Representative is responsible for keeping the property insurance records up to date for all residential customers, for monitoring insurance claims and maintaining First National’s force placed insurance policy. Demonstrate a keen understanding of First National’s culture, services, as well as the mortgage industry in general to understand the unique needs for each position.

  • Update cancellations
  • Follow up on insurance policies
  • Answer customer inquiries in a timely manner
  • Monitor insurance claims, while working with customers and insurance adjustors
  • Maintain force placed policy and report to insurance broker each month
  • Complete special projects as assigned by Management
This position requires linguistic fluency. Priority will be given to candidates completely fluent in English and French.

The Requirements Needed:
  • Post-secondary education and/or equivalent work experience required
  • Proficient in MS Office applications, specifically Outlook, Word and Excel
  • Strong communication skills, verbal and written, in both French and English
  • Confident and assertive phone manner
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Proven ability to accurately process high volumes of work
  • Proven organizational skills and demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task
Why join First National?

  • Bright open concept office environment
  • Large kitchens with a coffee and latte maker to enjoy at no cost
  • Supportive teamwork focused environment
  • Collaborative entrepreneurial spirit
  • Opportunities to give back to the communities and work through events focused on a variety of charities
  • Ongoing social events throughout the year
  • Extensive training programs to set our employees up for success
First National is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to diversity and inclusion regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.

First National supports requests for accommodation from applicants with disabilities; please contact Human Resources at accessibility@firstnational.ca.

We would like to thank all applications for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

#FNLOQC

title: newReceptionist/Office Administrator
description:
Focus Physiotherapy is a group of 6 rehabilitation clinics in the GTA.

We are currently seeking a motivated, enthusiastic individual with good communication skills for a part time position on the front desk at our Brampton location.

Duties include, greeting patients, completing intake paperwork, answering telephones, maintaining patient files, scheduling appointments, reminder calls to clients, liaising with insurance adjustors and some billing.

Knowledge of EHC, OHIP and MVA paperwork is a plus.

Must have previous experience with Universal scheduling software.

Competitive salary. Flexible hours.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$22.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends
  • On call

COVID-19 considerations:
Enhanced covid protocols in place.

Education:

  • DCS / DEC (preferred)

Experience:

  • administrative assistant: 1 year (preferred)
  • receptionist: 1 year (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-06

title: newClaims Advocate - MGA Insurance Programs
description:
Claims Advocate Representative - MGA Insurance Program

Location: Burlington Ontario

The Claims Advocate Representative is responsible for advocating on behalf of our insurance customers in claims situations where necessary, as well as managing data of our insured clients and setting up new claims within our system. The Claims Advocate Representative is responsible for monitoring the progress of claims, creating claims records/reports, and providing authority for the payment of claims and processing of cheques when applicable.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Monitor incoming claims, and verify information in the claims system with policy application and/or wordings
  • Monitor initial reserve, change or close reserve and file as required.
  • Monitor and update system with required file notes and status update, follow up on and, review cheque status or cancellation and provide updates as required to management.
  • Create or save documents in appropriate file (incoming or outgoing communication).
  • Assess estimate request, update and closure request (multiline).
  • Review and complete daily reports if required.
  • Send notification to client and communicate with insurer and adjusters as required.
  • Respond to internal or external inquiries
  • Ensure broker partner is kept informed about the progress of the claim through regular contact with the adjustors.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Licensing

  • Enrolled or completed a post-secondary, insurance related program.
  • 1-2 previous insurance adjusting experience
  • CIP enrolled or willing to complete same
  • Wiling to be licensed in multiple jurisdictions

Skills & Knowledge

  • Ability to commute to the office located in Burlington, Ontario. (Hybrid- set up)
  • Strong organizational and analytical skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Solid problem solving and decision-making ability.
  • Computer proficiency.
  • High energy, organized, self-starter
  • Strong work ethic, goal oriented
  • Collaborative team player

The above reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this position but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. The above responsibilities are representative only; management may modify the duties and responsibilities to this position at any time.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to $30.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Private office. Full vaccination

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Burlington, ON L7L 6W6: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • commercial insurance claims: 1 year (preferred)

title: Claims Builder (Insurance Restorations)
description:
Peak RSG Services is an independent restoration company that operates in major markets across Canada. We provide unsurpassed emergency response, restoration and reconstruction services to the insurance industry supported by an industry leading claims management system and a team of dedicated project co-ordinators and technical experts.

Peak RSG Services is part of The Peak Group of Companies – a leader in the home improvement industry and supplier of innovative building products throughout Canada and the United States. Our greatest strength is our people, a team of remarkably talented and passionate people. We are a place where innovation is encouraged, talent and teamwork are celebrated and results and success are rewarded.

We are experiencing continuous growth and have an immediate opening for the Insurance Claims Builder located in for our office located in Calgary, AB (hybrid). The position will be reporting to the Claims Desk Manager. Key Responsibilities and Qualifications include, but are not limited, to the following:

Key Responsibilities

  • Build insurance estimates
  • Expedite insurance estimates assuring service levels are being met
  • Respond and follow up with adjustors on estimate inquiries
  • Collaboratively work with the order desk, Project Coordinators, Project Managers, and Insurance Estimators
  • Assist the Order Desk in processing and ordering products
  • Assist with monitoring job gross margins insuring job profitability
  • Assist with claim building training of other team members

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 2 years customer service experience in a fast paced business environment
  • Experience working for an insurance company is an asset
  • Exceptional attention to detail and strong organization skills
  • Experience in a multi-tasking, deadline oriented, fast paced environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong mathematical skills
  • Xactimate/Coelogic knowledge preferred

The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Construction estimating: 1 year (preferred)
  • Xactimate / Coelogic: 1 year (preferred)

title: newManager, Insurance and Operational Risk
description:
Job Description


The role of the Manager Insurance and Operational Risk is to coordinate and oversee the planning, design, and continuous development of the national occupational health & safety program. Success within this role will be measured by the ability to provide a safe and healthy workplace for employees and to reduce overall occupational injuries and accidents. This will be achieved by,

  • Recognition, evaluation, and control of occupational hazards.
  • Providing consultation through visitation and the delivery of training material,
  • Develop and implement policies, procedures, and systems to reduce reportable injuries
  • Manage daily submission of Incident Reports (ILTs) and respond to, or follow-up with locations, consulting with Insurance Adjustors as required.
  • Manage the Canadian and U.S. insurance renewal process, including the collection, updating, and ongoing analysis of pertinent underwriting data.
  • Works in collaboration with key stakeholders such as Legal, Real Estate, Design & Construction, and Operations, to establish programs and processes, set benchmarks, and standards of practice.
  • Supports development and implementation of local initiatives to upgrade facilities to a status of venues with accident-free records. This includes all Cineplex properties (i.e., theatres, LBEs, Offices, and Joint-Ventures).
  • Provide regular reporting, analysis, and metrics on accident trends,
  • Review and provide insightful industry updates on changing Insurance changes and options, making recommendations to improve coverage.
  • Proactively conduct site assessments to identify potential risks and liabilities and implement risk/liability mitigation strategies.

Qualifications
  • Post-secondary education in a relevant field such as Insurance, Claims Management, and / or Risk Management.
  • Canadian Risk Management (CRM), Chartered Insurance Professional (CIP), and / or Risk Management Certificate completed designations or in progress, would be an asset.
  • 3 to 5 years of insurance or claims related experience, preferably in a multi-location national retail / food environment.
  • Experience reviewing insurance policies and negotiating varying levels of coverage and company friendly deductible amounts with Brokers.
  • Experience in implementing a culture of safety and developing strong safety leadership.
  • Experience developing and fostering relationships, leading projects, change management, and working collaboratively with individuals, teams, and external service providers.
  • Experience in report writing, presenting, and explaining recommendations to managers.
  • Health and Safety experience is an asset, particularly if its in a multi-location national retail / food environment in Canada and / or the United States.
  • Must have excellent communication skills, both written and oral.
  • Being fluent in oral and written communication in French would be an asset.
  • Must be confident and self-assured and have good judgment.
  • Should be able to set priorities and allocate time accordingly.
  • Must have strong interpersonal skills.
  • Must have the ability to learn business systems/procedures quickly.

Additional Information


Inclusion & Diversity:

Cineplex is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We encourage and welcome applications from all intersectional walks of life. The collective sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talent represents a significant part of our culture. By valuing a diverse workforce, we enforce hiring practices that are fair and equitable.

Accessibility

Cineplex is committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit or restrict their access to employment opportunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us at 416-323-6600 or via email at jobs@cineplex.com.Interested applicants, please apply today.

No Agency Calls Please

title: newCapital Projects Manager
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Capital Projects Manager that understand both the big picture and the micro-level tasks of building maintenance to ensure their smooth operation for years to come.

About us: Centretown Citizens Ottawa Corporation (CCOC) is a community-based, tenant and member directed, non-profit housing organization whose mission is to create, maintain and promote housing for low and moderate-income people. We are a progressive employer of choice that values diversity, collaboration, inclusive and open decision-making, innovation, creativity, and sustainability in all that we do.

Are you the right fit for our team? Team of two (2) Capital Projects Managers responsible for implementing and administering all of CCOC’s special maintenance and capital repairs projects, including disaster recovery projects. CCOC is a provider of affordable housing and strives to be a Landlord of choice, as such the needs of our tenants and communication with them forms a significant part of all our project planning. The successful applicant will have exemplary people skills to manage projects that impact tenant’s day to day lives with sensitivity and open communication.

Our ideal candidate 5-10 years of practical experience in the field. You should have a working knowledge of construction scopes and activities, scheduling, project management and contract software.

You are someone who is as comfortable working with schedules and budgets in the office as you are on a construction site. You’re at ease talking to diverse groups of people including tenants, funders, and contractors.

Our Project Managers, hold themselves accountable for providing a highly professional service controlling scope, timeliness and budget in a non-profit environment, requiring efficient use of resources.

The work load will include high value projects and a large volume of lower value short duration projects. Regardless of capital value CCOC strives to bring professional management to all of our projects from inception to close out.

Formal education in project management is a significant asset.

Position type: Regular full-time 35-hour work week.

Compensation: Starting wage between $61,327 and $72,149, based on experience and qualifications. The maximum compensation for this position is $82,971.

Benefits: OMERS defined benefits pension plan; Employee and Family Assistance Plan (EFAP); and generous time-off from day one. Group Insurance and Supplementary Medical Plan (dental/eyewear) after six (6) months of employment.

Application deadline: 9:00 am, Monday, May 16th.

How to apply: Forward resume and cover letter by email

It is CCOC’s goal to be an inclusive organization and we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live and serve. We, therefore, actively seek to recruit candidates who are Indigenous, Black, Persons of Colour (IBPoC), persons from the LGBTQIA2+ community, persons with disabilities and women.

Preference will be given to candidates with skills in additional languages, and candidates with personal or professional experience with marginalized communities.

While we appreciate all applications, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you require accommodation during the interview process, please advise us when initially contacted.

Capital Projects Manager

Reports To: Director, Facilities Management

Department: Facilities Management

Summary

The Capital Project Manager is responsible for implementing and administering special maintenance and capital repair projects, including disaster recovery projects. The Manager also maintains and updates the capital plan.

Responsibilities (this is not an exhaustive list)

1. Manage capital repair projects by:

  • Scheduling capital repair projects throughout the year to maximize efficiency and minimize cost
  • Ensuring the preparation of plans, specifications, and scopes of work for projects, arranging for permits if required
  • Arranging the tender of contracts, assessing bids received, and preparing and or reviewing contract documents
  • Overseeing the execution of contracts, performing site inspections and deficiency follow-up
  • Recommending payment of invoices and release of holdbacks
  • Coordinating accommodations for tenant needs during a project
  • Being responsible for all site safety for ongoing projects
  • Being responsible for risk management for all capital plans and projects.

2. Analyses expenses and prepares reports and budgets for submission to the Director of Facilities Management by:

  • Reviewing and summarizing annual building inspections
  • Identifying potential major capital projects and preparing estimates of costs and benefits of same
  • Preparing draft capital works budgets for all properties and providing required analysis for review by the Director of Facilities Management and Facilities Management Committee
  • Maintaining a long-term capital plan, and all costs related to specific projects and updating the plan at the completion of each project.

3. Responds to emergency capital repairs by:

  • Assessing damage as soon as possible after emergency events, such as floods and fires and updating the Director of Facilities Management and Executive Director as required
  • Working with tenants to arrange emergency accommodation if needed
  • Working with insurance adjustors as needed to devise a repair plan
  • Overseeing repair work as required, monitoring costs and ensuring prompt reinstatement.

4. Provides information and resource services by:

  • Identifying and securing funding opportunities, including performing any reporting required
  • Collaborating with the Director of Facilities Management for the purposes of evaluating and prioritizing major capital projects
  • Scheduling and ensuring appropriate resources for planned projects
  • Keeping informed of other relevant regulations as outlined in the building, property standards, and fire safety codes, and all standard Health and Safety practices and regulations
  • Assisting the Director of Facilities Management in establishing new or revised procedures pertaining to the implementation of capital repairs and informing staff
  • Communicating with tenants on the status of work and attending meetings, including from time to time Facilities Management Committee meetings, tenant/building meetings
  • Providing regular report on the status of capital projects to the Facilities Management Committee

5. Perform other duties as requested by the Director of Facilities Management or the

Executive Director.

This position supports the work of Centretown Citizens Ottawa Corporation, Centretown Citizens Housing Co-Operative and Cahdco (Centretown Affordable Housing Development Corporation).

Education and Experience

  • 3 years of post-secondary education*
  • 5 years of related work experience*
  • Advanced ability to use Microsoft Office Suite
  • Knowledge of Yardi Voyager will be considered an asset
  • Intermediate verbal and written communication in English
  • Ability to communicate in French is considered as asset but not required
  • Valid Ontario Class G Driver’s License and access to a working vehicle

*Combination of experience and training with demonstrated performance and ability may substitute for stipulated academic requirements.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $61,327.00-$72,149.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Ottawa, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Project management: 5 years (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-16

title: Claims Team Assistant
description:
HUB International is continuously GROWING, and we are looking for individuals with an ENTREPRENEURIAL mindset to join our team!

We are BC’s largest insurance broker, growing 15% year over year! We offer stability, career development opportunities, and a strong teamworking environment. Whether you’re just starting out in insurance, or a seasoned veteran, HUB can take you to your next career goal.

We are Proud to Offer

Competitive compensation

Comprehensive tuition financing and career-related training and development

Company matching RRSP contributions

Customizable flexible benefits options for you and your family

We promote work-life balance through flexible scheduling and hours

A progressive employee assistance program through LifeWorks

Mental and physical wellness initiatives

HUB Cares: we are a company that gives back and is active in the community

Mileage reimbursement for vehicle use (if applicable)

The Opportunity

As a Claims Team Assistant, you will work closely with the claims team to provide administrative support and help direct client inquires. We are seeking a self-motivated individual with a strong attention to detail to join our Burnaby Head Office location in a Full Time Permanent position.

Our Burnaby Still Creek head office location is centrally located near Brentwood Town Centre and Gilmore station in the Willingdon Business Park. This location is skytrain accessible with many shops, restaurants and other amenities nearby.

The Responsibilities

First things first, you’ll assist in the claims process by being the first point of contact for opening new claims, collecting and processing information

You’ll answer in-bound claims calls from: clients, carriers, and internal & external adjustors

You will support clients by providing information regarding the status of claims

You’ll work closely with and support the claim administrative and advocacy teams

You’ll update claims in the claims management system based on input and reports from carriers and adjusters

The Requirements

Minimum of 2 years’ experience in similar administrative roles

Obtain a Level 1 General Insurance License or willing to obtain your license

You’re proficient with MS Office, with focus on Excel and Word

Strong attention to detail

Solid work ethic and a ‘can-do’ attitude

Proven ability to work in a team environment as well as independently

Exceptional organizational and time management skills

Excellent communication both written and orally

Asset experience that will make you stand out:
Insurance industry experience is an asset

Familiarity with EPIC is an asset

Our Culture Starts with You

We are looking for SELF-STARTERS with an ENTREPRENEURIAL mindset who will take OWNERSHIP of their business

We want you to be INNOVATIVE and open to sharing your ideas

You work with URGENCY while providing a high level of PROFESSIONAL SERVICE towards our customers, communities, & colleagues.

You are a TEAM PLAYER who positively impact those around them; We MOTIVATE each other to GROW TOGETHER

You work with a high degree of INTEGRITY and ACCOUNTABILITY

To find associated positions at our HUB simply search myHUBbc as a keyword in the search bar on our careers page!

Department Office Administration & Clerical

Required Experience: 1-2 years of relevant experience

Required Travel: No Travel Required

Required Education: High school or equivalent

title: Receptionist/Administrator
description:
Full Time/Part Time Receptionist/Administrator- Physiotherapy Clinic

Front desk position available in a busy physiotherapy clinic in Mission, BC. ( Inside the Mission Leisure Center). The ideal candidate must be flexible in working the hours between 7am and 6pm Monday to Friday. This can be a permanent full time position (30-32) per week: 10-5 (occasionally till 6 )Monday to Thursday and Fridays 7:30-4. Or Part- time position ( 20-25) example 12-5 Monday to Friday. Other shifts may be available.

The successful candidate must possess the following:

- experience in a similar setting is a must

- Experience in using an EMR program specifically Clinicmaster or Jane

- Experience with using Microsoft Office and have excellent computer skills

- Efficient in cash handling, POS, balancing end of day and month accounting

- Strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritize, organize and multi-task

- Self-motivated, able to work independently and with another front administrator, physiotherapists and kinesiologists.

- Professional, with an outgoing, pleasant personality

- Great communication skills and excellent customer service skills

- Ability to problem solve, quick learner, must be able to manage to work in a fast pace environment, answering phones and booking and billing clients

- Comfortable on the phone talking with adjustors, funders and case managers

- Must follow clinic policies for Covid-19 as they are constantly updated

- Preference given to those who live close by within the area as short notice might be required for fill in if someone is sick.

We are looking for someone who is committed to being part of our team long term. Position is available immediately to give plenty of time to get comfortable with our clinic operations.

Please submit your resume and cover letter to our email address.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $19.00-$20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
At this time masks are encouraged. We continue with hand washing, cleaning and social distancing as able.

Experience:

  • office receptionist: 2 years (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-04-24
Expected start date: 2022-04-18

title: newEstimator (Insurance Restorations)
description:
Peak RSG Services is an independent restoration company that operates in major markets across Canada. We provide unsurpassed emergency response, restoration and reconstruction services to the insurance industry supported by an industry leading claims management system and a team of dedicated project co-ordinators and technical experts.

Peak RSG Services is part of The Peak Group of Companies – a leader in the home improvement industry and supplier of innovative building products throughout Canada and the United States. Our greatest strength is our people, a team of remarkably talented and passionate people. We are a place where innovation is encouraged, talent and teamwork are celebrated and results and success are rewarded.

We are experiencing continuous growth and have an immediate opening for the Insurance Claims Builder located in for our office located in Calgary, AB (hybrid). The position will be reporting to the Claims Desk Manager. Key Responsibilities and Qualifications include, but are not limited, to the following:

Key Responsibilities

  • Build insurance estimates
  • Expedite insurance estimates assuring service levels are being met
  • Respond and follow up with adjustors on estimate inquiries
  • Collaboratively work with the order desk, Project Coordinators, Project Managers, and Insurance Estimators
  • Assist the Order Desk in processing and ordering products
  • Assist with monitoring job gross margins insuring job profitability
  • Assist with claim building training of other team members

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 2 years customer service experience in a fast paced business environment
  • Experience working for an insurance company is an asset
  • Exceptional attention to detail and strong organization skills
  • Experience in a multi-tasking, deadline oriented, fast paced environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong mathematical skills
  • Xactimate/Coelogic knowledge preferred

The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Construction estimating: 1 year (preferred)
  • Xactimate / Coelogic: 1 year (preferred)

title: Project Manager
description:
ServiceMaster Restore Grey – Bruce has immediate opening for a Project Manager, located out of our Owen Sound branch.

ServiceMaster Restore Grey - Bruce is the largest independent disaster restoration company in Grey Bruce. We provide unsurpassed emergency response, restoration and reconstruction services to the insurance industry, residential, commercial and industrial customers. With full service coverage and 24/7 emergency service, we offer a wide range of services that remediate conditions caused by fires, floods, winds, mould, environmental hazards, accidents and other casualties at any type of facility.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Project Manager (PM) is responsible for developing a definition of the project, in conjunction with the Property Owner, Adjuster, or Insurance Company. The PM ensures that the project is delivered on time and to the required quality standard (within agreed specifications).

Focus is on scoping and estimating the work required to restore properties to their pre-disaster state; prepares detailed specifications and submits quote for the work to be performed; directly interacts with clients to develop applicable solutions and close the sale; generates new leads through relationships with adjusters and property managers; delivers exceptional customer service to insurance stakeholders, homeowners, and property managers.

The PM will implement ServiceMaster Restore training procedures pertaining to emergency calls and water remediation.

The PM is capable of implementing water remediation procedures consistent with the IICRC S-500 Standard and recording psychrometric readings.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Revenue Growth/Sales:

Initial customer contact within 30 minutes of receiving assignment and first customer visit within 24 hours of receiving the assignment.

Emergency Estimate Timeline as per SVM SOP (5 days) or KPI of customer.

Rebuild Emergency Timeline as per SVM SOP (10 days) or KPI of customer.

Emergency Work Authorization signed and deductible collected before work commences.

Employee Engagement/Leadership.

Build, lead and deploy the best quality team to achieving the objectives of our corporate strategic plan.

Ensure that the company health and safety policies and procedures are followed for all SVM personnel and sub-contractors, including all branch personnel are up to date with all health and safety procedures and training and participates/conducts tail gate meetings relating to health and safety and work procedures when on site.

Develop a performance culture through a robust performance management process with all employees having regular feedback and specific development plans.

Develop a culture of ‘employer of choice’ to attract, retain and motivate the best quality team.

Cost Efficiency/Operations:

Focuses his team’s efforts to teach, improve, and practice mitigation techniques.

Responsible for accurate job costing and estimation and ensuring project job costs are within target margins.

Customer Service Excellence:

Educates the client filling the claimant in on i) the process of repair ii) timing of service delivery and iii) what the client can expect from ServiceMaster Restore Grey Bruce in the process.

Manages all aspects of water claims i.e. mitigation, equipment selection, equipment staging, psychrometrics and reports consistent with the IICRC S-500 model.

Learns and practices the SVM SOP for:

Water Remediation

Mould

Asbestos

Monitors customer satisfaction throughout the Emergency Phase.

Ensure project requirements are being fulfilled and deadlines and milestones are achieved.

Inspect progress and work quality throughout the Emergency Phase.

Develop and maintain strong relationships and act as a prime liaison with policy holders, and adjustors).

Maximize customer satisfaction.

Ensure collective and individual expectations are met.

Facilitate prompt and quality service.

Resolve disputes and complaints, where possible.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience and Education:

Minimum 5 years’ experience in the restoration/emergency industry.

Detailed understanding of reconstruction practices for property that has suffered water, wind, mould, fire and vandalism damages.

Knowledge of building codes and electrical, or plumbing, or mechanical and related codes.

Knowledge of the laws and ordinances regulating building construction.

Strong communication and sales skills, both written and verbal.

Computer skills required – effectively use Word, Excel, Outlook and Xactimate..

Accounting skills – basic understanding of invoicing, billing and general math skills.

Ability to work as part of a team and demonstrated commitment to customer service excellence.

University degree or college diploma in business, engineering, or construction management preferred; or combination of relevant training courses in related fields and relevant experience may be acceptable in lieu of the academic requirements.

Formal training in a related field.

DesiredTechnical Qualifications:

Water Remediation Technician (WRT) certification.

Fire and Smoke Restoration Technician certification (FSRT).

Odor Control Technician certification (OCT).

Proficiency with biological Technology.

Certification in mould remediation an asset but will train.

Additional requirements:

Excellent leadership and entrepreneurial skills.

Analytical, detail oriented, hands on, and a team player.

Customer service orientation with the ability to deal with customers under stressful situations.

Skilled at management of multiple projects, opportunity analysis and decision-making.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, ServiceMaster Restore Grey Bruce will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

We would like to thank you in advance for your application; however only those selected will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $65,000.00-$80,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Owen Sound, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Project management: 1 year (preferred)
  • Business Project & Program Management Occupations: 1 year (preferred)

title: Project Manager Assistant
description:
Project Manager Assistant

PuroClean North Simcoe & Muskoka

Gravenhurst, ON

Full-time, Permanent

PuroClean has an opportunity for a Project Manager Assistant in the Gravenhurst office.

PuroClean North Simcoe & Muskoka is a locally owned and operated residential and commercial restoration company that is part of a large continent wide network. PuroClean is driven to provide an unmatched service experience quickly, professionally, ethically and with compassion, resulting in peace of mind for all concerned. We believe in people and in continuous growth and improvement; not only those we help, but also those who are on our team.

PuroClean North Simcoe & Muskoka provides 24-hour emergency, plus cleaning and rebuild services to people who have suffered water, fire, asbestos, biological and mould damages to their homes and businesses.

Position Summary

The Project Manager Assistant provides support to the Project Manager by coordinating project activities related to any and all projects. The position’s primary duties are to ensure the continuity and efficiency of each project from start to finish through clear communication to all parties involved. The Project

Manager Assistant handles multiple projects within a fast-paced environment and is open to constant changes and challenges. The ideal candidate will be highly organized and able to manage multiple projects at once in the absence of day-to- day guidance. The Project Manager Assistant will help the project manager to ensure accurate estimates are completed, project statuses are documented, internal and subcontracted crews are assigned, materials are procured, and invoices are prepared.

Responsibilities

  • Management of projects under the guidance of the Project Manager
  • Assist Project Manager with the successful full cycle of assigned projects from start to finish
  • Assist Project Manager with the proper reporting and uploading of notes & documents to insurance companies.
  • Address questions/concerns throughout the project
  • Ensure work authorization, completion certificates and all other required documents are obtained from customer
  • Update and manage all Restoration Manager and Xactanalysis data associated with specific jobs as to meet insurance reporting requirements.
  • Ensure that managers, employees and subcontractors complete the job in a timely and cost-effective manner
  • Demonstrate a “can do” attitude at all times and is a team player
  • Submit any required information to the customer, adjustor or subcontractor as directed by the Project Manager
  • Be capable of short-term coverage of the project in the event the Project

Manager is absent

  • Assist with reception relief as needed
  • Participate in after hours ‘on call’ rotation including taking calls, dispatching and attending losses if/when required

Qualifications

  • IICRC certificates an asset
  • Experience in the restoration business an asset
  • Experience with Restoration Manager, Xactanalysis, Xactimate an asset
  • Minimum 1-year administrative experience preferred
  • Understanding of provincial safety guidelines and ability to manage them on site and while traveling
  • Effective written and oral communication
  • Effective math skills
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds
  • Valid G license and clean driving record

Benefits

  • Learn and develop new professional skills in a fast-paced environment
  • Serving members of your community in their times of need – “Servant

Based Leadership”

  • Being part of a winning team with the “One Team” mentality
  • Competitive pay with flexible hours
  • Additional perks and benefits based on performance and employer’s policies
  • Ability to work in and manage projects in arguably one of the most beautiful areas of the province!

Work Schedule

  • Full-time, permanent
  • Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm
  • Rotating on call schedule
  • Weekend/holiday availability (when on call)
  • Occasional overtime

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $35,000.00-$60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • On call
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
PuroClean North Simcoe and Muskoka is dedicated to safe guarding the health and wellbeing of both its employees and customers. Although no longer mandated, the wearing of face masks is highly encouraged.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Gravenhurst, ON P1P 1X4: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Secondary School (required)

title: Accident Adjuster
description:
At Day & Ross, you’ll go far.
Day & Ross is one of Canada’s largest transportation companies, serving top brands across North America. We got our start hauling potatoes in 1950, and now we have a team of more than 8,000 employees, drivers and owner operators.


We believe our people are our greatest strength – and we treat them like family. For over a decade, we’ve been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, and we have been named a Top Company for Women to Work for in Transportation every year since 2018. Our industry recognition is a testament to the family values we share with our parent company, McCain Foods Limited.


About the Role

Accident Adjuster
Full-time
Hartland, NB


The Accident Adjusted is responsible for managing and processing vehicle accident and equipment theft claims from investigation through to settlement with the objective of mitigating company losses.


How You’ll Help

  • Following detailed procedures, opens claim file and begins investigation as soon as accident claim or equipment theft is reported or assigned
  • Liaise with insurance appraisals/adjustors, legal, and third party insurers as required
  • Establish and maintain claim files in the Accident Claim System
  • Provide analysis and make recommendations to senior management on claims litigation
  • Follow up to ensure all details are finalized and claim is closed
  • Participates in an on-call rotation to ensure coverage 24/7/365
  • Other related duties as may be required.


Your Skills & Experience:

  • Post secondary education, preferably in Business Administration, Insurance and Risk Management or another related field.
  • Training in accident investigation.
  • A suitable combination of education and/or experience may also be considered.
  • Minimum of three years’ related experience in a professional environment, preferably in the insurance and/or transportation industries
  • Previous experience in claims management a strong asset.
  • Working knowledge of tractor-trailer equipment
  • Computer skills, including knowledge, ability, and accuracy when using MS products, AS400,and other web based programs
  • Communication (verbal and written) as well as customer relationship management skills
  • Strong problem solving and negotiation skills to bring claims files to a close in a professional manner and in keeping with the objective of mitigating losses.
  • Ability to handle multiple files and to multitask and prioritize
  • Ability to make sound, well thought out recommendations and decisions
  • Results focused


To apply, visit the Careers page on our website at dayross.com.


Day & Ross is committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, visitors, vendors, customers, and other members of our communities. In line with our culture and values, we believe that being vaccinated is the most effective way to protect each other. It is therefore a requirement that the successful candidate for this role be fully vaccinated and have completed the mandatory incubation period prior to the candidate’s start date with Day & Ross.


Day & Ross is committed to applying the foregoing in accordance with applicable human rights legislation. The Company will review all requests for reasonable accommodation based on a protected ground on a case-by-case basis, and such accommodations will be granted where they do not cause Day & Ross undue hardship or pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others.


Please note that the successful candidate will be asked to provide reference and criminal background checks prior to employment. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.


As a federally regulated employer, Day & Ross fully supports the principles of employment equity and encourages all qualified members of the designated groups to apply.

title: Project Manager
description:
Project Manager

PuroClean North Simcoe & Muskoka

Gravenhurst, ON

Full-time, Permanent

PuroClean has an opportunity for a Project Manager in the Gravenhurst office.

PuroClean North Simcoe & Muskoka is a locally owned and operated residential and commercial restoration company that is part of a larger continent wide network. PuroClean is driven to provide an unmatched service experience quickly, professionally, ethically and with compassion, resulting in peace of mind for all concerned. We believe in people and in continuous growth and improvement; not only those we help, but also those who are on our team.

PuroClean North Simcoe & Muskoka provides 24-hour emergency plus cleaning and rebuild services to people who have suffered water, fire, asbestos, biological and mould damages to their homes and businesses.

Position Summary

The Project Manager is a leader within the organization and is responsible for the sales activity of the office directly with the customer or insurance representative, by creating accurate estimates of all jobs, then ensuring the work is completed in a note-worthy fashion. The Project Manager maintains and improves the office’s competitive position through exceptional customer service, while ensuring maximum sales revenue at minimum cost through accurate estimating plus exceptional project scheduling & procurement to ensure appropriate margins are achieved on all assignments.

Responsibilities

  • Attend new assignments to initiate claims process
  • Deliver preliminary reports to the insurance representative within 24 hours of the initial inspection
  • Determine services required to mitigate customer losses and prepare cost estimates for each phase of the assignment
  • Organize emergency, contents, cleaning and rebuild crews / subcontractors as needed for each assignment
  • Maintain appropriate turn around times for the reporting and invoicing on all assignments
  • Act as a liaison for job needs between customers, adjustors and the production crews, including arranging and attending pre-job conferences and any work quality issues
  • Update and manage all Restoration Manager and Xactanalysis data associated with specific jobs as to meet insurance reporting requirements
  • Promptly communicate Change Orders for customer additions or upgrade
  • Maintain a positive relationship with other companies in the restoration, reconstruction and insurance industries and other related industries
  • Participate in after hours ‘on call’ rotation including taking calls, dispatching and attending losses if/when required

Qualifications

  • Prior Project Management in an engineering/construction environmental an asset
  • Prior experience in the restoration industry an asset
  • IICRC Certification in Water Remediation Technician (WRT) and/or Fire and Smoke Restoration Technician (FSRT) and/or Mould (AMRT) an asset
  • Asbestos remediation certification an asset
  • Experience with Restoration Manager, Xactanalysis, Xactimate an asset
  • Understanding of provincial safety guidelines and ability to manage them on site and while traveling
  • Strong planning and organizational skills
  • A clean driving record and valid G driver’s license is mandatory

Benefits

  • Learn and develop new professional skills in a fast-paced environment
  • Serving your community in their times of need – “Servant Based

Leadership”

  • Being part of a winning team with the “One Team” mentality.
  • Competitive pay and flexible hours
  • Additional perks and benefits based on performance and employer’s policies
  • Ability to work in and manage projects in arguably one of the most beautiful areas of the province!

Work Schedule

  • Full-time, permanent
  • Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm
  • Rotating on call schedule
  • Weekend/holiday availability (when on call)
  • Occasional overtime

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $48,695.00-$80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
PuroClean North Simcoe & Muskoka is pro-active in guarding the health of its employees and customers. Although no longer mandatory, we highly encourage the wearing of face masks. We continuously sanitize surfaces in our office.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Gravenhurst, ON P1P 1X4: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Project management: 1 year (preferred)

title: Claims Advocacy Specialist
description:
Marsh is seeking candidates for the following position based in the Montreal office:


Claims Advocate

What can you expect?

The Claims Advocate is responsible for facilitating loss management within the defined operational parameters of the claims team to ensure the prompt and equitable resolution of client claims. Reporting directly to the Eastern Claims Leader, this position requires a professional with experience in client claims advocacy, insurer claim examination and or third party claim adjusting. The successful candidate will manage a diverse claim portfolio for clients in all sectors. This individual will be technically focused and able to drive initiatives to handle complex claims across multiple lines of insurance.

What is in it for you?

Marsh Canada offers competitive employee benefits and a thriving culture to bring your authentic self to work

  • Culture of internal mobility, collaboration and valued partnership with HR from the business.
  • Employee Resource Groups which provide access to leaders, relevant volunteer and mentoring opportunities and interactions with counterparts in industry groups and client organizations.
  • Full benefits package – starting day one
  • Generous Parental Leave and Tuition Reimbursement plan per year and participation in our Employee Stock Purchase Plan (regional specificity required)
  • Generous paid time off, additional floating holidays, time off to give back to your community
  • Multiple medical, dental, and vision plans with choices to fit all needs and budgets

We will count on you to:

Manage client advocacy activities by:

  • Having ownership of hands-on active claim management, coverage reviews, problem solving and settlement strategies for clients.
  • Analyzing loss details to determine appropriate policies and coverage.
  • Driving the claims process for clients through participation in claims strategy discussions in order to ensure progress and equitable resolution.
  • Interacting closely with internal Client Executives and Claims Advocacy colleagues to better the claim experience for clients.
  • Having a strong focus on clients and providing value-add claim services
  • Working closely with internal and external leadership groups to foster understanding of how to mitigate Marsh risk by closing claims optimally.
  • Providing support to Broking teams by participating in the creation of client specific claim protocols.
  • Monitoring insurer responses to reported claims and engaging with insurers and their professional advisers in order to support the expeditious and smooth resolution of claims.
  • Liaising and working closely with other claims team members to develop claim management best practice.
  • Drafting communication to clients and/or insurers and reviewing documents prepared by the clients, in order to support the claims process.

What you need to have:

  • Experience in a claims environment either at the adjustor, carrier or brokerage level
  • Claim Adjusting license (AMF)
  • Excellent written, presentation and communication skills both in English and French
  • Understanding of relevant insurance law and claim litigation procedures is an asset
  • Exposure to large, complex corporate client losses
  • An understanding of insurance market claim procedures
  • Motivated, independent, self-starter capable of working in a dynamic, fast paced team environment
  • Experience with Property & Casualty insurance
  • Negotiation skills and ability to develop claim strategies
  • Works well under pressure and is accountable for deliverables
  • Ability to build strong professional relationships
  • A basic understanding of risk and mitigation strategies
  • Proficient in Microsoft office applications

What makes you stand out:

  • CIP, FCIP, CRM, all assets

In accordance with applicable legislation, Marsh will provide a reasonable accommodation to employees and prospective employees to the point of undue hardship upon request and as required in respect of the individual’s particular restrictions and limitations. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or medical need please contact TANA@mmc.com.

Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser. With over 35,000 colleagues operating in more than 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the leading global professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue approaching US $17 billion and 76,000 colleagues worldwide, MMC helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer, and Oliver Wyman. Follow Marsh on Twitter @MarshGlobal; LinkedIn; Facebook; and YouTube, or subscribe to BRINK.

Marsh McLennan is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people regardless of their sex/gender, marital or parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

title: title
description: description

title: Administrative Assistant - Patient Services
description:
About Oxford Wellness clinic

Oxford Wellness Clinic has been providing quality Chiropractic Care since 2015. We strive to provide the highest quality of evidence-driven holistic care individualized to each patients needs. Our comforting and casual environment is welcoming and will make you feel relaxed each time you visit.

When it comes to patient care, Dr. Sidhu uses a combination of techniques and focuses on treating the root cause of the problem as well as its symptoms. Dr. Sidhu enjoys working with a diverse group of patient demographics and values building long-term relationships of wellness with them.

About YOU

You will be the first point of contact with our patients so to be the right fit for our team, you are friendly, energetic, positive, kind, compassionate and you bring an enthusiastic approach to your everyday. You must feel passionate about wellness and bring that passion to work. You are reliable and on time. If you do not have Clinic experience, do not worry... we have a comprehensive training and onboarding plan.

What is in it for you?

Job Satisfaction: You will be the first point of contact for all our patients, and you will get to work directly with all members of our team and be included in a healthy work environment driven of optimal wellness.

Job Variation: You will never get bored in this fast-paced environment. Each patient is important to us, and you get to be part of their journey to ongoing wellness.

Job Opportunity: You will be exposed to opportunities to grow and develop within our clinic as we continue to expand into other areas of wellness.

Culture: You will get to work with fun, dynamic and highly skilled people that are driven to succeed. Not to mention, everyone here strongly believes in optimal health & wellness for both mind and body.

Qualifications/Required Knowledge & Skills

  • Front desk (First Impressions) administration and patient services experience a MUST.
  • Professional in person and phone etiquette a MUST.
  • Experienced with Chirosuite or other patient booking systems an asset.
  • Experienced with insurance billing an asset.
  • Experienced with MVA billing an asset.
  • Effective and efficient communication skills required.
  • Able to work in fast paced multi-practitioner clinic with a strong sense of priority.
  • Must be able to work any of the clinic hours.
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft office applications, outlook and teams.
  • Must be able to adapt to changes and shifting priorities.

Responsibilities

  • Works to achieve standards of excellence and demonstrates flexible and efficient time management, with a strong ability to prioritize workload and presents positive solutions.
  • Works closely with other administrative assistants, office management, Dr.’s and practitioners’ team to ensure a positive patient experience for all our patients.
  • Providing administrative support with creating documents, spreadsheets and presentations.
  • Responsible for start of day and end of day SOP’s (Standard operating practices) including balancing of Poynt system.
  • Proficient with patient file management including but not limited to:
  • Uploading documents to patients’ files and maintaining files within the existing SOP of the clinic.
  • Strict adherence to patient confidentiality
  • Assisting patients with understanding the MVA protocol.
  • Accurate maintenance of MVA files including documentation, checking end dates, sending reports to adjustors and working with Office Manager and Dr.’s to ensure reporting are completed on time.
  • Accurate collection and recording of patient and clinic information which includes exceptional active listening skills with all team members and patients to ensure treatment plans are understood to assist with optimal wellness in our patients.
  • Responsible for patient follow-up including maintaining call list, following up with patient care to ensure they are scheduled and/or rescheduled as needed.
  • Responsible to adhere to clinic protocol in relation to the internal orthotics program.
  • Adhere to all internal clinic procedures, processes, guidelines & policies.
  • Light cleaning duties daily.
  • Additional job responsibilities as required and assigned by Office Manager.

If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, please contact us with your resume! Stay Healthy & Happy

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $17.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • Front desk: 1 year (required)
  • Administrative experience: 1 year (required)

Language:

  • English (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-13
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

Show more

title: Project Coordinator (Insurance Restorations)
description:
Peak RSG Services is an independent restoration company that operates in major markets across Canada. We provide unsurpassed emergency response, restoration and reconstruction services to the insurance industry supported by an industry leading claims management system and a team of dedicated project co-ordinators and technical experts.

Peak RSG Services is part of The Peak Group of Companies – a leader in the home improvement industry and supplier of innovative building products throughout Canada and the United States. Our greatest strength is our people, a team of remarkably talented and passionate people. We are a place where innovation is encouraged, talent and teamwork are celebrated and results and success are rewarded.

We are experiencing continuous growth and have two immediate openings for the Project Coordinator position. Key Responsibilities and Qualifications include, but are not limited, to the following:

Key Responsibilities

  • Act as the key contact, facilitator and trouble-shooter for the policy holder, and the adjustor, from the initial call to final job completion. Provide helpful, articulate and timely service and updates, both by phone and through Xactware (the industry standard software platform) to the policy holder and adjuster throughout the entire process that delights them.
  • Promptly and professionally responding to all customer and adjuster inquiries, coordinating loss site visits, emergency and restoration work, scheduling arrival of materials, work crews and production schedules.
  • Effectively dispatching work orders to crews, processing deductibles and invoice payments, calculating revenue and expenses of the insurance claims for multiple projects simultaneously timely and accurately.
  • Perform any other duties as assigned by the supervisors.

Experience, Traits and Qualifications

  • Extraordinary organization and multitasking skills, able to administer hundreds of insurance exterior restorations simultaneously and accurately
  • A naturally customer-centric and sales-driven team player who is extremely helpful and always demonstrates a “yes, can do” attitude
  • Excellent communication skills in English (both verbal and written), able to communicate in an engaging, passionate and empathetic manner
  • Demonstrate promptness, professionalism and courtesy at all times by keeping promises and taking good care of our customers
  • Computer proficiency, comfortable using different systems and applications
  • Previous experience navigating XactAnalysis and a Customer Relationship Management system is preferred

The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Xactanalysis: 1 year (preferred)
